TEI.2.document_title: David G Burnet to Stephen F Austin, 05-04-1829

barker_notes.barker_summary: David G. Burnet to Austin, Cincinnati, Ohio, May 4, 1829. Robert Owen's plans for a socialistic colony in Texas. General interest in Texas.
barker_notes.barker_footnotes: apparently Robert Owen. For some account of his plan—or one phase of It—see William R. Manning, Early Diplomatic Relations between the United States and Mexico, 323-324. General Arthur G. Wavel. For his relations with Austin in 1823, see index of Volume I of this collection. He was granted a contract on March 9, 1826, to settle 400 families in Texas, and Benjamin R. Milam became his agent.
barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 213-214

*div1 type="summary"* *p*David G. Burnet to Austin, Cincinnati, Ohio, May 4, 1829. Robert Owen's plans for a socialistic colony in Texas. General interest in Texas.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*Cincinnati*/location_mentioned* *date_mentioned n="0-04-1829">4 May 1829*/date_mentioned**/p* *p*My dear Sir*/p*
*p*I have for several days anticipated the present opportunity with a full intention of writing copiously to my *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned**person_mentioned*friends*/person_mentioned*— but the person by whom I send to *location_mentioned*Natchitoches */location_mentioned*sets out in the *date_mentioned n="05-05-1829">morning*/date_mentioned* Some days earlier than he expected when I last saw him— My time is so short (for it is now 10 ociock p. m.) that I should let the conveyance pass by altogether were it not for my desire to transmit to you the inclosed very queer document—The *person_mentioned*author */person_mentioned*with whose character I presume you are familiar? is now here-—he has Called on me twice and seems to be deeply interested in *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*and perfectly confident of the practicability of his Utopian Social System, and its peculiar adaptation to the condition or rather the "circumstances" of our beautiful *location_mentioned*country*/location_mentioned*— He appears to be influenced by a sincere benevolence—but while I am willing to beleive he is an honest *person_mentioned*philanthropist*/person_mentioned*, I am constrained to think him a misguided and infatuated visionary— He leaves here in a few days for *location_mentioned*England*/location_mentioned*, goes from thence to *location_mentioned*Colombia*/location_mentioned*, to enlighten the *person_mentioned*Liberator */person_mentioned*and from thence he returns to *location_mentioned*Mexico */location_mentioned*to compleat his arrangements with that *person_mentioned*Government*/person_mentioned*, and when that shall be accomplished, he proposes to pass over land to *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned*.*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Genl Wavill*/person_mentioned* with his *person_mentioned*family */person_mentioned*has been here about *date_mentioned n="04-21-1829">two weeks*/date_mentioned*— his *person_mentioned*wife*/person_mentioned*, a very amiable *person_mentioned*English Lady*/person_mentioned* presented him with a fine little *person_mentioned*daughter */person_mentioned**date_mentioned n="04-28-1829">this day a week ago.*/date_mentioned* He will leave in *date_mentioned n="05-14-1829">about 10 days*/date_mentioned* and after visiting some of the *location_mentioned*eastern cities*/location_mentioned* will proceed to *location_mentioned*England*/location_mentioned* where he expects to remain some time— I have found him an intelligent gentlemanly man— I expect *person_mentioned*Milam */person_mentioned*here in a few days and as I am informed, it is probable *person_mentioned*Peck */person_mentioned*will be with him—we shall have quite a coterie of *person_mentioned*Coahuilatexanos*/person_mentioned*—*/p*
*p*I have no news of any peculiar interest. If I can have time in the morning I'll put [up] a packet of papers for you. I regret very much being so taken by surprise on this occassion but when I recollect that no one in *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*has thought it worth while to write to me, it seems as if I might be compromitting myself by multiplying my unreciprocated communications— I have sent many letters and many *location_mentioned*newspapers*/location_mentioned* since the waters rose and have not received an acknowledgment of either—but I will not do so much discredit to the frankness of others as to believe that any other motive will be attributed to me than the true one, a desire to confer gratification on those whom I esteem— Remember me very affectionately to all friends *person_mentioned*Williams*/person_mentioned*, *person_mentioned*Brown*/person_mentioned*, *person_mentioned*League*/person_mentioned*, *person_mentioned*Nuckols */person_mentioned*etc etc and to *person_mentioned*Mrs Long*/person_mentioned* and the *person_mentioned*Ladies */person_mentioned*generally—*/p*
*p*May God bless and preserve and prosper you—*/p* *p**person_mentioned*David G Burnet */person_mentioned* [Rubric]*/p* *p**person_mentioned*Col Austin*/person_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
